COMMENTS: 1) The number of affected population does not include injuries nor deaths, but the number of Total_affected DOES include them and the values is different

1) 15 people were reported as severely injured and dozens with minor injuries (converted to INJURIES_LIGHT). These "dozens" were referred as at least 24.
2) There are buildings that had accumulated damage from Zagreb 2020 earthquake on march of the same year. 
3) EUR 4.12 billion come from damaged physical assets and EUR 714 million refers to losses. 
4) Losses include production of goods and services that will not be obtained, higher costs of operation and production, and the cost of the humanitarian assistance activities. 
See more under assessment methodology.

REFERENCE: International Federation of Red Cross And Red Crescent Societies: https://adore.ifrc.org/Download.aspx?FileId=394712
COMMENTS:
1)  out of 36 injured people, 10 had severe injuries
2) Since the beginning of operation, a total of 12,300 people have received some shelter assistance provided by
CRC:
a) 1400 were registered by the Red Cross as "sheltered"
b) 3,000 people in housing containers in front of their houses, some
c) 5,000 in alternative accommodation with their families or in leased undamaged property, as well as
d)  2,900 people accommodated outside the area affected by earthquake.

1) 30 people saved from the rubbles
2) 36 injured people were hospitalized
3) one death was a child 
4) out of 70000 people affected, 13750 were children
5) 1500 families near Sisak, Petrijna and Glina have been confirmed to lost their homes
